required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of Entecavir and Tenofovir Monotherapy for the Treatment of Nucleos(t)Ide-na√Øve Patients With Chronic Hepatitis B in Korea

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic hepatitis B virus infection is an important cause of morbidity and mortality. Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and entecavir were licensed for the treatment of hepatitis B virus infection. In this study, the investigators will try to make comparison between Entecavir and Tenofovir and investigate the efficacy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline HBV DNA level at 3, 6, 9, 12 months after taking entecavir or tenofovir
primary_outcome.description: Patients will check the HBV DNA level at 3, 6, 9, 12 months after taking entecavir and tenofovir

secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline ALT level at 3,6,9,12 months after taking entecavir or tenofovir
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will check the level of alanine transaminasel at 3, 6, 9, 12 months after taking entecavir and tenofovir

study_pop.textblock: treatment of nucleos(t)ide-naive patients who were diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B in Korea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 < Age < 70
- HBV DNA > 100,000 copies/mL and increased ALT over 2 times compared with normal range if HBsAg (+), HBeAg (+)
- HBV DNA > 10,000 copies/mL and increased ALT compared with normal range if HBsAg (+), HBeAg (-)
Exclusion Criteria:
- With HCV or other liver disease
- With kidney disease
- decompensated liver cirrhosis
- with hepatocellular carcinoma
- refuse this clinical trials

facility.name: Gachon University Gil Medical Center, Department of Gastroenterology
